meanings.definition: In a way that causes fear or terror.
meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm outside was frightfully loud.
meanings.sent2: She was frightfully scared of the dark forest.
meanings.sent3: The little puppy barked frightfully at its own reflection.
meanings.sent4: The haunted house looked frightfully alive in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The ghost story was told so frightfully that everyone jumped.

meanings.sent2: He was frightfully tired after running all day.
meanings.sent3: The clown's shoes were frightfully big for his tiny feet.
meanings.sent4: The mountain was frightfully high, reaching the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick went frightfully wrong, surprising everyone.
